revised_title: The Role of Uterine Contractions and Respiratory Movements in the Circulation of the Pregnant Uterus
tldr: This article investigates the role of uterine contractions and respiratory movements in facilitating the circulation of blood within the pregnant uterus. The author demonstrates that these contractions act as a supplementary heart, assisting the movement of fluids and improving circulation, while respiratory movements cause a bulging of the uterine wall, further aiding in the circulation of blood.
